html.display_name: The Electric Field and Potential of Conducting Cylindrical Shells Carrying Charge
html.p: A long solid metal cylindrical rod of radius [mathjaxinline]a[/mathjaxinline] is surrounded by a thin cylindrical metal shell of radius [mathjaxinline]b[/mathjaxinline]. The inner cylinder carries positive charge per unit length [mathjaxinline]+\lambda[/mathjaxinline] and the outer shell carries a negative charge per unit length [mathjaxinline]-\lambda[/mathjaxinline]. Calculate the electric field (covered in Week 1) and the electric potential (covered in Week 2) at all radii [mathjaxinline]r[/mathjaxinline].
